channel.description:

yeah, i'm pi

item.title: How to do Multi-way-Combat? pi
item.dc:creator: @Get_Blitz Get Blitz
item.description:
@Get_Blitz wrote:

Orginally by i vain i, it may take some time to understand. go trough it slowly and you will understand everything.

X: (Blue -> Green) OR (Purple -> Orange)
Y: (Blue -> Purple) OR (Green -> Orange)

X[0]: //Blue -> Green
Blue: LOWEST_X_VALUE
Green: HIGHEST_X_VALUE

X[1]: //Purple -> Orange
Purple: LOWEST_X_VALUE
Orange: HIGHEST_X_VALUE

Y[0]: //Blue -> Purple
Blue: HIGHEST_Y_VALUE
Purple: LOWEST_Y_VALUE

Y[1]: //Green -> Orange
Green: HIGHEST_Y_VALUE
Orange: LOWEST_Y_VALUE

Read full topic

item.title: How to do Multi-way-Combat? pi
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

(absX >= 3072 && absX <= 3327 && absY >= 3608 && absY <= 3647)

That’s saying: If your absolute x position is greater than or equal to 3072, your absolute x position is also less than or equal to 3327, your absolute y position is greater than or equal to 3608, and your absolute y position is less than or equal to 3647, then that area is multi-combat. You would just have to add a double pipeline operator (||) between areas. || is like the equivalent to the word “or” in English.

Read full topic

– I know by that code that 3072 3608 is one corner… and 3327 3647 is a corner although i just… idk i don’t fully get it i still can’t make my area multi
